snippet: Party leaders have urged Democratic candidates to talk openly about the health care law’s problems while also offering their own prescriptions to fix them.
abstract: Democratic party leaders, coming to terms with continuing political liability attached to Pres Obama's health care law, are urging Democratic candidates in 2014 midterm elections to talk openly about law's problems and offer solutions; are hoping strategy may help them overcome threats to their ability to hold on to seats in House and Senate.
lead_paragraph: Party leaders have urged Democratic candidates to talk openly about the health care law’s problems while also offering their own prescriptions to fix them.

headline.main: On Health Act, Democrats Run in Fix-It Mode
headline.print_headline: On Health Act, Democrats Run in Fix-It Mode

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
